user-story.i-want: the feed to sustain 60fps with <2% jank and minimal battery drain
user-story.so-that: the viewing experience feels premium even on mid-range devices.

acceptance-criteria.criterion: Performance overlay (toggle via long-press) surfaces FPS, jank %, memory delta, and preload queue stats sourced from `feed_performance_service.dart`. [Source: docs/tech-spec-epic-4.md#source-tree--file-directives]
Automated performance tests (`feed_performance_ci_test.dart`) verify scroll FPS >= 60 (P90), jank <= 2%, memory growth < 50 MB across 200 swipes. [Source: docs/tech-spec-epic-4.md#test-traceability]
Frame timing instrumentation publishes metrics to Datadog (`feed.performance.fps`, `feed.performance.jank`) and sets alert thresholds. [Source: docs/tech-spec-epic-4.md#analytics--observability]
**PERFORMANCE CRITICAL**: CPU utilization remains ≤ 45% average during 5-minute session; Wakelock released within 3 seconds after feed exit. [Source: docs/tech-spec-epic-4.md#performance-metrics]
Battery saver mode disables auto-play and preloading while providing UI stump to re-enable; behaviour validated via integration tests. [Source: docs/tech-spec-epic-4.md#implementation-guide]

task.description: Implement `preload_debug_overlay.dart` showing live metrics and gating by feature flag `feed_performance_monitoring`.
Extend `feed_performance_service.dart` to gather frame stats via `SchedulerBinding.instance.addTimingsCallback`.
Wire BLoC events to disable auto-play/prefetch when `PowerManager` indicates low power mode.
Configure Datadog monitors for FPS < 55 and jank > 3% sustained over 5 minutes.
Add Firebase Performance custom traces `feed_scroll_start`/`feed_scroll_end` capturing latency buckets.
Document battery optimization toggles in release notes and QA checklist.
Build `feed_performance_ci_test.dart` harness using `integration_test` + `trace_action` to measure frame metrics.
Create manual QA script verifying battery saver override + wakelock release times.
